admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would enable Thailand to
            participate jointly with Thai Shell in exploring for &
            developing oil & gas reserves in Northern Thailand. The
            Government's objective is to strengthen PTT (Petroleum
            Authority of Thailand) with a view to enabling it to become
            an effective joint venture partner. PTT's participation
            in this venture is important as it is the first significant
            exploration/production joint venture for Thailand. The
            firsthand experience gained will help Thailand ensure that
            its overall framework for hydrocarbon exploration &
            development is appropriate, & is supportive of its
            policy of encouraging private sector involvement in oil/gas
            exploration. The project would comprise the establishment of
            the joint venture & its investment program up to 1988;
            the project would also include a technical assistance &
            training program which is directed both at enhancing
            PTT's role in relation to other joint venture options.
            The major benefits of the project, therefore, are
            strengthening Thailand's hydrocarbon exploration &
            development strategy, enhancing the role of the private
            sector, strengthening the institutional capability of PTT
            & resource mobilization. It will also provide an
            established framework for other such ventures including the
            basis for expeditious negotiations.
